definition[0]: something that covers all or part of your face, to protect or to hide it
example[1]: He was attacked and robbed by two people wearing masks.
definition[1]: something that covers your face, and has another face painted on it, which is used for ceremonies or special occasions
definition[2]: an expression or way of behaving that hides your real emotions or character
example[3]: Her sarcasm is a mask for her insecurity.
definition[3]: a substance that you put on your face and leave there for a short time to clean the skin or make it softer
definition[4]: if a smell, taste, sound etc is masked by a stronger one, it cannot be noticed because of the stronger one
example[5]: Liz turned on a radio to mask the noise.
example[6]: Air-fresheners mask bad smells instead of removing them.
definition[5]: to hide your feelings or the truth about a situation
example[7]: Men often mask their true feelings with humour.
definition[6]: to cover or hide something so that it cannot be clearly seen
example[8]: The new accommodation block has all but masked the original building.
